brewery.brewery_description: Microbrewery located in King Valley, VIC, Australia. Small system, big love!

beer.beer_description: Our amazing Altbier was missing only one thing, so at the top of our list this year was... more malt! Sticke Alt is a stronger "imperial" version of Altbier we created for Beer Cartel to provide super luxurious and malty beer to enjoy this Christmas period.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 265 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 54!

items.checkin_comment: Nose of raisin and caramel. Flavours add a golden syrup quality with a cinnamon and clove finish. Soft mouthfeel and much more gentle than the ABV would have you expect. Very nice.

beer.beer_description: A dark strong Belgian Ale with notes of toffee, sweet bread, cherry and molasses. Some background clove and spice from  the yeast.

You don’t have to be a superhero to enjoy a strong beer. Boasting a higher than average ABV, these styles really do pack a punch, so be ready for it. That's 35 different beers with style of Strong Ale - American, Strong Ale - English, Strong Ale - Other, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Golden Ale or Lager - Strong. Try 5 more for Level 8!

beer.beer_description: Smooth, easy drinking version of an alt bier. Medium body with malty flavour and easy drinkability, ready for the Australian summer

items.badge_description: Originating from Germany, the Altbier, or old beer, uses the old school brewing style of top fermentation and is left to condition for longer than normal. That's 5 different beers with the style of Altbier. Try 5 for more Level 2!

beer.beer_description: This is it! The beer you've been waiting for. Nothing says festive like allspice, fruit cake and whisky, and we've given it all to you in this velvety Christmas stocking of a beer. The ageing in single malt whisky casks from Backwoods adds vibrancy to an already stunning beer. We are overjoyed to share this special one off gift with you thanks to our mates at Carwyn.

One cannot live on dank hops alone. Tone down the bitterness and enjoy some smooth flavor. That's 200 different beers with an IBU of 20 or below. Try 5 more for Level 41!

At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. That's 50 different beers with the style of Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Lager - Dark, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black, Schwarzbier, or Mild - Dark. Try 5 more for Level 11!

beer.beer_description: Juicy Mango Berliner Weisse. Good tartness and plenty of mango. Great beer on any day of the week!

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 10 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 3!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 15 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 4!
It’s been a long day and now it’s time for a reward. Crisp, tasty and refreshing, enjoy that delicious fruit beer! That's 5 different fruited beers. Try 5 more for Level 2!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 120 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 25!

beer.beer_description: Slightly funky and estery Belgian Tripel. Big on flavour and brewed in a classic Belgian style, we won gold for this beer at the 2019 Indies and believe it's well deserved. If you like Belgians, this beer is a must!

user.bio: Trying to drink as many new beers as possible...

beer.beer_description: This is it! The beer you've been waiting for. Nothing says festive like allspice, fruit cake and whisky, and we've given it all to you in this velvety Christmas stocking of a beer. The ageing in single malt whisky casks from Backwoods adds vibrancy to an already stunning beer. We are overjoyed to share this special one off gift with you thanks to our mates at Carwyn.

items.badge_description: At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. That's 100 different beers with the style of Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Lager - Dark, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black, Schwarzbier, or Mild - Dark. Try 5 more for Level 21!

beer.beer_description: Slightly sweet, medium body Kolsch styled ale. Subtle fruity aroma with some spiciness from noble hops. A real crowd pleaser and easy drinking beer

Rich toffee, hint of coffee with full body and bready malt flavour. Dark brown with off white head and silky mouthfeel. Some Saaz hops to temper the sweetness with some herbal aroma. Lagered for a month before packaging, this is a beer worth pondering over.

beer.beer_name: Belgian Session IPA With Krush Hops
beer.beer_description: A golden Session IPA with a hint of mango and lychee from newly named Krush™ Hops. Fermented with our funky Belgian yeast to produce a refreshing zesty finish. We created this special beer for Carwyn Canvent, to be enjoyed in the sweltering heat of an Aussie Christmas.

Robust porter with 70kgs of figs grown on the farm at King River Brewing. Subdued fruitiness and additional sweetness from the figs balance out the chocolate and coffee notes from dark malts. Smooth mouthfeel and great malt complexity and aroma as the beer warms. The fig flavour is overt, like the fig sweetness, and is best experienced as the beer warms 10-14 degrees

Slightly funky and estery Belgian Tripel. Big on flavour and brewed in a classic Belgian style, we won gold for this beer at the 2019 Indies and believe it's well deserved. If you like Belgians, this beer is a must!

At last, a flagship Pale Ale from KRB! Stonefruit, citrus, and passionfruit aromas on a golden light-bodied Pale Ale. We dry hop with the freshest North East Victorian hops we can find which provides a crisp and fruity taste.
Smooth, easy drinking version of an alt bier. Medium body with malty flavour and easy drinkability, ready for the Australian summer

Brewed with a Single Malt and Single Hop principle, with all Belgian Pale Malt and boiled for 90 minutes to add additional colour and sweetness this drinks like a sweet XPA. A massive 25 kg of Galaxy Hops from HPA was used imparting prominent passionfruit, mango and candied orange characters.
Juicy Mango Berliner Weisse. Good tartness and plenty of mango. Great beer on any day of the week!

Spiced up braggot using caramelised honey (Bochet). It took 2 days at 80 degrees to caramelise the honey and it results in a wonderfully intense natural honey flavour. Using a mixutre of munich and schooner base malts to add some malt depth to this beer we have a great balance between the honey and the malt. Star Anise, ginger root and nutmeg were added in some measure to add lingering spice notes. Enjoy!
Very hoppy, clean bitterness and very smashable!
Dark lager with hints of sweet bread and plenty of roasted coffee and bitter chocolate notes that don't linger on the palate. A wonderfully subtle dark beer.
Light european style pilsner with a lemondrop hop addition to add a citrus hint to this very refreshing mid strength!
Clove aroma and sweet tasting with a dry finish. Medium body with hints of banana, clove and bread.

Our amazing Altbier was missing only one thing, so at the top of our list this year was... more malt! Sticke Alt is a stronger "imperial" version of Altbier we created for Beer Cartel to provide super luxurious and malty beer to enjoy this Christmas period.

This single batch wet hopped beer has been made with Voyager Veloria malt and green Eclipse hops. This produces characteristics of citrus peel, sweet mandarin and fresh pine needles. The hops we use are sourced from HPA’s Rostrevor hop gardens.

Bronze Medal winner at the 2024 Australian International Beer Awards

Medium to lean bodied Amber Ale. Inspired by French farmhouse ale traditions, the Biere De Garde gets its name from storing (Garde-ing) the beer. This results in a well rounded Amber ale, like a Saison but with more malt character.

We were once again invited to create a beer for the Carwyn Black Box and Adambier is a style deeply rooted in our passion for historical biers. Dark and malty, with a hint of smoke from oak smoked wheat. Notes of toffee, caramel and a hint of cigar all wrapped up in roasted wheat.
Local blueberries give this classic German beer style a berry-delicious flavour. The dark lager style is known to monks as “beer bread”, so maybe this is a pre-dinner beer. Brewed for GABS 2019.
sweet, bready malt, bit of biscuit. Very drinkable.
Premium Czech pale lager using Australian bittering hops, Australian single Origin malts and finished off with spicy noble Saaz. Fresh high country Victoria water really brings out a fresh character.
